features: 【Care Your Health】Made from high quality glass this glass electric tea kettle is durable and stain resistant. All the places of this water kettle in contact with water are health-class materials for preserving natural flavors and preventing taste contaminations.

【Save Your Time】With 1.7 Liters (57oz) large capacity plus 1100 Watt concealed heating element, hot water kettle Adam will save you a lot of time when you need boiling water for instant oatmeal, for making coffee or tea.
【Boil-dry Protection】Auto Shutoff and boil-dry protection feature will automatically switch off power once water has reached the boiling temperature or boiled away.

【Love Your Choice】Featuring on blue-ray, the glass kettle can give you visual enjoyment when it working; Roll the cable at the bottom of the base, and that is easy to store; Cordless technology allows for hassle-free pouring; Non-slip handle prevents grip loss; Convenient water level gauge.
【Two-Year Warranty】To clean, mix 3 tbsp of vinegar or lemon with water, and leave 5-8 hours after boiling or overnight. 2-year warranty. please contact us freely if you have any questions.

reviews.reviewText: From a safety standpoint as well as ease of use, this electric kettle performs well, and I made some observations and took measurements., The 2.5ft long power cord is stamped with "(UL) SJT 16AWG 300V" with a non-polarized male plug resembling a NEMA 5-15P although not specified with known markings other than "UL". The Intertek label on the power base shows "900-1100W" and "Conforms to UL STD 1082" which is the correct UL specification for this type of household device., The kettle glass appears flawless and of uniform thickness with 0.5L (MIN), 1.0L and 1.7L (MAX) markings on two opposite sides, the plastic parts are of smooth and flat/satin finishes with no mold separation flash, and the base containing the heating element and LED has an outer plastic cover with the same Intertek label. The LED lamp(s?) in the kettle base reflect off a prismed o-ring lens that appears to be part of the glass flask bottom. The handle has an upper push switch which opens the spring-loaded cover, and a lower rocker switch with "I" and "O" positions for power. Electrical power is made with a circular female connector in the center of the kettle base which seats on a male connector centered on the power base., I followed the instructions and twice operated the kettle with a full (MAX) 1.7L fill up. Using cool tap water measured at 68F, the kettle took exactly 9.0 minutes to reach a rolling boil measured at 211-212F using both an infrared non-contact thermometer and a probe type immersion thermometer. The kettle automatically shuts off after about 20 seconds at full boil and a small screen attachment on the lid behind the pour spout prevents splashing of water outside of the kettle during boiling and also acts as a baffle to prevent flow surges while pouring. Removing the kettle from the base is a simple lift-up motion off the power base and the power base does not conduct any significant heat., Overall I have no negative comments, find this appliance very easy to use, and am confident in safety features.

reviews.reviewTitle: Okay, the blue light is pretty cool...
reviews.reviewText: "I never needed a kettle until I got sick and all I could think of was some hot tea. This kettle had good reviews and a good price so I went for it. The kettle was ready to go as soon as I got it - I opened the box, followed the quick and easy cleaning instructions and set her to work. I must admit, I didnt care at all about the light when I bought it, but when I fired it up, it was pretty cool.", "A note: when I was looking at reviews myself, I noticed some that said it didnt heat up quickly. Im not really sure what theyre going on about - it heats up fast, lights up, and has an automatic turn-off. And a good price."

Just got this kettle, took over 7 minutes to boil half pot of water...cord does not retract into base...although it says it’s glass, feels like plastic...not very happy with this purchase. Update I d cider to return this product, the handle got too hot to hold the last time I used it....

This tea-kettle was delivered at 2:39 PM this afternoon, after running it thru 2 water cycles to clean the machine of any residual dust I started a half full pot for a cup of tea and after that boiled, I heard a snap and saw that the glass was cracked near the bottom base.  At 3:10 PM I requested a refund which was promptly approved by Amazon., I think that the glass is too thin.  I was really looking forward to this new kettle but I will investigate another brand.

I like a lots of things about this. It is easy to clean because it is glass, it boil water fast, it quieter than my old one. The blue light is nice. But but but it is not safe. Asking why? Because it is glass and if it brakes while boil water is in it then you are done. So be very careful when handling it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Boils water quickly. Easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: I like it that the opening is wide, making it esay to learn the inside. The Electric kettle gets my water hotter than the stove did! I also feel much safer knowing that the kettle will turn itself off if I unintentionally leave the room. It looks nice too!

"This unit looks great, and in the end it does what its supposed to.. it just isnt the quickest. I bought this because my mom has an electric kettle and it boys water super quick, I figured this would make french press coffee easier than boiling a pot on the stove. It takes over 5 minutes to boil .5L (minimum volume) not super impressed."
It works fine, it looks fine. It is not as fast as I expected: it takes at least 12 minutes to boil 1.7 L of water and it takes at least 7 minutes to boil 0.5 L of water at room temperature.

"\xa0I bought this for my wife so she wouldnt have to keep putting the kettle on downstairs.  She loves it.  It heats up fast (nothing crazy but nothing too slow) and makes a great cup of tea.  It takes about 4 minutes to get 1 liter to the boiling point.  I like that it shuts off after a minute or two so it doesnt burn off all the water.  We keep it unplugged when not in use just to be safe."

"I love this kettle. Been using it a few months now. Its very simple and easy to use. It looks very nice. Boils water quickly then shuts itself off. I use it for tea, oatmeal, noodles. Only wish I had was the ability to adjust temp to leave it on. Although I knew before hand this wasnt an option. So that in no way affects my review."

I bought this to heat water for tea and it has been a great product. It heats super fast, which is really nice., Many of my teas are not meant to be placed in boiling water, so being able to keep an eye on the water is very helpful., And, we are avoiding plastic, which is so toxic when it’s heated., The best part, though, is that the bottom lights up with blue light when it’s in use.  It’s just a little fun.  It shuts off automatically and the light goes out, so you know your beverage is ready., A very nice product.

"I purchased the electric kettle because I enjoy a cup of tea before bed and my stovetop one is quite loud when it whistles.  My kids bedroom is near the kitchen and nothing is worse than getting a munchkin to bed and having to worry if you can catch the kettle before it wakes the light sleeping 3 year-old.  The kettle works as advertised, its fast, water heats up nice and hot, love the beautiful blue light, and was so excited when it arrived a day earlier than anticipated.  Im thinking of purchasing one for my parents because my dad is a tea drinker and oatmeal eater who lost his electric kettle when they moved recently."

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for a quick cup of coffee or tea to go!
reviews.reviewText: "Ive been looking to replace my old metal stove-top kettle for quite sometime now, as Im often trying to get a good quick cup of coffee on the go especially in the mornings, but that old stove-top kettle takes over 10 minutes to bring to a boil. I swear, boiling water in a pot is fast than that old kettle. It doesnt make sense, but I swear its true!", "I finally decided to make the upgrade to an electric kettle, and after doing some research I settled on glass over stainless steel and plastic. I simply didnt like the idea of having boiling water Im putting in my body every single day anywhere near plastics even if they were BPA-free, and stainless steel really is the most durable option but also tends to rust after some time.", After researching glass kettles, this one seemed like the best balance between price and reputation. In fact, this was one of the few products I checked that had A ratings on both fakespot and reviewmeta, which are websites for identifying products with fake reviews and manipulated reputations, publishing reliability grades on product reviews and Amazon product reputations., "Its been about 3 weeks now, and so far, its been an absolutely wonderful purchase. Combined with my new coffee grinder and my new metal drip coffee filter, my mornings have improved significantly! If you are looking for a nice glass electric kettle at a reasonable price, I would definitely recommend giving this one a try."
This kettle is so beautiful. I just love it.

I love this kettle. I got it when I first moved into my apartment and didn’t have a coffee maker yet. I had an old coffee press and this heats up the water so that I can make my coffee efficiently and cheaply. I also use it for tea! It takes just a few seconds for the water to reach the right temp and then the switch shuts off on its own. No more worrying about leaving the kettle on when I leave for the day!

reviews.reviewTitle: Plastic taste after proper cleaning and run-throughs
reviews.reviewText: "Upon arrival, I have cleaned out the kettle with soap and water. I also ran the kettle couple of times and right away noticed that there was a plastic smell coming from both steam and water, which I didnt mind until I tried making coffee and tea that ended up with bad plastic after-taste.", On top of that, when pouring hot water, the steam goes through many holes of the top plastic cap burning the hand as you pour contents out. The glass also feels more like plastic than glass., Nevertheless, going to be returning this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Did what it said it would do, but dang is it LOUD
reviews.reviewText: "Did it do what it said it would do?  Yes, it boiled 1.7L water relatively quickly (didnt time it) and the blue light was a nice touch.  However, while warming up, it got very loud as if I was running a noisy power drill in my kitchen.  This lasted several minutes until a full boil when it shut off.  The water cooled somewhat quickly (still rather hot), perhaps due to the pitcher being mostly glass instead of steel.  However, the water cooled enough after 30 minutes that Id need to reheat it to be sufficiently hot to steep my tea.  It was too loud to deal with reheating again.  I planned to bring this to an open office space to go beside a couple coffee makers, but the kettle is way too loud for that space.  Not sure if I just got a lemon or if the entire line is like mine, but I returned it the next day."

This item is so easy to set up and use.  I love the blue light is kind of fun.  Heats fairly quickly. 1.5 liters takes an average of 7 mins., It shuts itself off when it reaches boiling.  I wish the light stayed on though., The only big complaint I have is the cord is so stiff that storing it is nearly impossible.  This would not prevent me from buying this again though., It also stays warm for awhile aswell and base stays cool so you can set kettle anywhere.

reviews.reviewTitle: Takes too long to boil - fire hazard
reviews.reviewText: This kettle has been a nightmare from the beginning. It takes sooooooo long to boil and now it’s decided to turn itself on randomly even when there’s no water in it, so it stinks like burnt metal. It’s very creepy to hear strange noises in your kitchen and walk in to find your empty kettle boiling, then turning off, then turning on again. And it’s probably a fire hazard waiting to happen.

"I have been using this glass kettle for a few months now and I love it! It heats up the water so fast. I just wish they sold a smaller one because I only heat up 12 to 14 oz at a time. Its a little too big for what I need it for but its still a great electric water kettle. Great quality glass water kettle for the price!"

This is a great, high quality tea kettle.  The basin is made of a sturdy glass, which looks nice and heats up quickly when boiling water.  The kettle also includes a small strainer in the lip of the spout, which is great for straining teas.  However, my favorite part of this kettle is that it glows blue while it is heating up which is very aesthetically pleasing.  The light also adds convenience because when the water is done boiling, the light turns off so that you know it is ready.

reviews.reviewTitle: Takes forever to come to a boil
reviews.reviewText: It looks great, just not as practical as my last electric kettle. This takes a LONG time to come to a boil. My last one would boil within 2 minutes and this one takes over 10 minutes to come to a boil. I’ll be buying another Model.

I’ve used this for my daily oatmeal and never noticed a taste because i put berries and fruit in my oatmeal. I noticed it after my sister had made tea in it. I still use it for my oats since the fruit covers the taste but i can definitely taste the plastic when i don’t put fruit in. So only use if you are using with strong flavored things. I wish i would’ve returned it before i got used to the quickness.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cheap materials led to short lifespan.
reviews.reviewText: We liked the design and the price, but it lasted only five months of approximately twice daily use before refusing to turn on. Wouldn’t buy this one again.
We used it four days  before it started leaking a ton of scalding hot water from the bottom

What’s there not to like! Really this is the best electric water kettle I ever owned. Love making tea in this. It’s easy to clean and the presentation is nice and clean looking, which I love. I even took it to my hotel to warm up baby bottles, tea, make cup of noodles for my three year old, lol.. I would definitely buy this again or give this as a gift.
For the price of the kettle, i was a bit hesitant at first. I’m glad i got it, it works amazing and the blue light is pretty cool, no Problems and easy to clean

reviews.reviewTitle: Loved it so much I bought a second
reviews.reviewText: "I originally purchased this item for my visiting grandmother.  She needed something in her room so she didnt have to walk very far carrying hot coffee. (she will only drink instant).  So I purchased this kettle for her safety.  It boils within a minute or two and has auto shut off.  How Grand!  When turned on, it has a pretty indigo light.  I loved it so much, I purchased one for myself.  Thank you."

The water that boils from this kettle taste great unlike some previous steel type kettle that I bought in the past that makes the water taste bad. Love the glass and the LED. You can see the water boils and it does not take long. It can get loud, but it is nice to auto turn off when the water is boiled. Very good size.

"I love my kettle, it does exactly what its supposed to whilst looking badass. It fits a nice amount of water so I can make tea for a whole household of 4 if need be. I like the design aesthetically and functionally. I love how the cord wraps around the base, and how I can see into the kettle just in case it gets dirty or something.", "I wrote this review at 2am because I drank too much tea and now I cant sleep."

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent product great price as well!!
reviews.reviewText: It’s great it got delivered by UPS awhile ago., Put water in it twice to boil as instructed to boil away manufacture residue., Was please that it heats up the water quickly., Very pleased with the product and the price is just right!?

I love this electric Water Kettle. It’s just what I needed for my hot water needs, like making coffee, tea, oatmeal. The water boils quickly and hot! The kettle turns off when it’s boiled which works for me as I get busy and forget I’ve got water on. The nice blue LED light goes on when the pot is on and shuts off when the pot boils like the water. This is one of my favorite kitchen things and a great deal for the price!

"So glad I selected this kettle!  Its huge - bigger than I expected from the picture.  Heats up REALLY fast - bubbles start as soon as you hit the button and within a minute its boiling.  It lights up blue when on, which looks really cool.  Then once it boils, it turns itself off.  I couldnt ask for anything better - I love this and am so happy I purchased it."

reviews.reviewTitle: Well engineered, fits most decor. Led lighting when heating a plus.
reviews.reviewText: "The carafe feels solidly built, fits nicely on its base, and the blue led lights can be seen from several rooms away if you have a direct line of sight. When they go out, the auto shut-off kicks in, and your water has finished coming to a boil. If I remember, Ill update to 5 stars in a year or two if it is still functioning like new."

My favorite Christmas gift to me. I drink tea constantly. This pot boiled water quickly, had auto shut off- which great since I get distracted easily- and has this pretty blue light- which is just pretty., Good product- great value.

I absolutely love this kettle,heats up to boil quickly and love the blue lights,very pretty. The handle is great and has built in filter where you pour the water out from.the base is sturdy and cord is thick,not flimsy. I will be purchasing a few more for Xmas gifts,love mine!!

It boils water so fast, I really enjoy it with my french press. I also feel more comfortable letting my kids help make cups of soup and things like that with the kettle verses boiling water on the stove or in the microwave.
Its breaking on the side and leaking

"This thing heats water fast and looks good doing it. Ive used it extensively since I got it, and Im completely satisfied. Initially and periodically the bottom surface of the chamber discolors, but it also fixes itself after a rinse or an additional use."

"I gave this 5 stars for flavor because it doesnt leave any flavor behind. I use this kettle several times a day and its quick, clean, and efficient. Im not sure why I held onto my old leaky kettle so long and didnt switch over to this sooner!"

"I cant wait for winter. I bought this as I am a tea lover. This is amazing. it not only makes boiling hot water in literally 2 minutes, the blue LED lights are really cool. It just adds a bit of enjoyment to my crazy workday mornings."
I thought this was too good to be true. This kettle takes too long to boil water and on top of it it stopped working two months after purchase. Returned.

reviews.reviewTitle: DID NOT LAST PAST SIX MONTHS
reviews.reviewText: Loved it at first nice look heats up quickly in about 5 mins after two months STOPPED working waste of my hard working money

I continue to be impressed with this water kettle.  Boils fast.  Looks beautiful with a blue light while water is boiling.  The light automatically goes off when boiling is done.  And, the price was affordable.
My wife loves tea at work and wanted one of these. So she got it. All thanks to me mind you. She loves it. Makes super hot water, and can have tea whenever she wants.

It boils the water and provides a nice light show while you wait., "Its certainly not the fastest tea kettle. If youre looking for water to be boiled in 30 seconds to a minute, then you should probably spend more money on a different product. For the price, cant complain."

I love this kettle! Between the glass and lights, it’s one of the most visually appealing kettles I’ve seen! My only complaint is that it feels a bit flimsy for a kettle and it isn’t as heavy and sturdy as I expected it to feel. As a previous review mentioned, a full pot does take 7 minutes to boil, but I was prepared for that for the price. Other than that, works great and functions well!

I bought this for my boyfriend and he loves it a lot. His favorite color is blue and is very happy with the blue led. His mom always wanted one so she stole it from his room to put in the kitchen and they make tea every morning together. This kettle is very easy to use and safe aa it turns off on its own. It is fast and efficient. However when boiling, the glass heats up and the precipitation make the inside glass look dirty. It is very adequate.
When using this kettle the water boils fast! I typically use this to boil water for my morning pour over coffee or evening tea. The added LEDs are cool!

This is so much more convenient and much faster than the microwave or on the stove. It takes less than 7 minutes to boil 1 liter (half full) of cold refrigerated water; where it takes over 15 minutes to heat the same amount of water in the microwave. Very happy I made this purchase.

Works great! Boiled a whole pitcher of water in 2-3 minutes and has a built in strainer in the pour spout if you want to boil or infuse teas and herbs inside it. Made of glass, so it can be scoured and cleaned much like a coffee pot.

It’s a little slow to get to a full boil but I like the light and it’s easy to clean my only other issue is more of a me issue. I constantly hit the button to open the lid instead of the power button.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice kettle, would buy again.
reviews.reviewText: I love this kettle. Looks super cool when lit up in my kitchen at night. However, the connection part has begun to rust and I’m contacting amazon to see if they will send a replacement. Other than that, love this kettle and would recommend. Maybe just take extra precaution to keep the bottom part extra dry.

Wow! I got this today and pulled it out of the box and read the simple instructions so find that it’s SUPER easy to use. Just plug in the base and fill with water and click the button. I didn’t know it lights up till I turned it on and that made me very excited. I watched it get to a boil and then automatically shut off which was nice. Great product!! I’m so happy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Unfortunately failed after about five months of three to five times daily use
reviews.reviewText: I used my Aigostar Adam Electric Water Kettle many times every day between about April 15, 2019 and November 12, 2019 - when it stopped working., Yesterday I would have definitely given this product a five star review, but today, I can only give it two stars., However, even though the product support eligibility ended on October 9, 2019, I just might buy another one.

My first electric kettle and I’m impressed! It will heat a full pot within minutes and the taste is great. I empty mine completely and leave the lid up  after every use so it dries quickly. I haven’t had to clean hard water or anything out of it yet. The blue light is a nice touch and when it goes off, that’s the only way you know your water is ready since it doesn’t whistle or beep.
Made of glass, easy to broken. Do not buy if your not a carefully user. Pro. It got led light inside when boiling water. But very very easy to smash. Cuz mine is gone first day it arrived

reviews.reviewTitle: Bulky and doesnt stay hot long
reviews.reviewText: Its a lot bulkier then i would like. It heats up very hot however, because it turns itself off the water doesnt stay hot for as long as I would like it to. I wish it had a timer and dint shut off right when done so the water could stay hot longer.

"Well done, practical and fast. A must-have for a single person or a family, for coffee, teas, baby bottles, etc. At schools or offices at the lounge. It doesnt use a lot of room in your kitchen and looks nice. 5 stars."

"Its an electric kettle. It heats up fast, turns off before the water is all over the place, and you splash some water in it to clean it. The blue LEDs are nice but a bit bright. So yeah...its a kettle."
"I love it so far. A little afraid the glass isnt durable because of reviews Ive read but so far so good for me. Its such a beautiful item with the blue light and it heats water super fast."

I love this electric kettle. Did not give it all the stars because the glass its like a coffee make glass. Its very thin and its scary every time I clean it. Also because it does not keep the water hot for a long time. Just like a coffee maker. But its a great Item if u just want hot water on the spot for tea ect.

reviews.reviewTitle: Rocked on base and then quit working after about 5 heatings - had to return
reviews.reviewText: My review title pretty much says it.  If it had not quit working I would have kept it as it seemed to work well enough except for not fitting securely on the base.

Heats up good just dont like that the heating switch does not automatically shut off. It does when the water boils but when you put it back on the plate it starts again till you have to hit the switch off

"I use this for instant mashed potatoes and boiling my sons infant water. It holds about half a gallon of water and it is quick and easy to use. Plus, it looks really cool. I can see from the living room when it turns off and is ready."
"I use it daily! Cant go wrong with it. Great for coffee teas, etc. Boils water in minutes ! Wont go back to boiling water on the stove or microwave ever again."

First of all, this kettle has an incredibly strong chemical smell that is really hard to get rid of. I washed and soaked it in soap and water, vinegar, bicarb, etc, and it STILL smelled like it was going to give me cancer. Only laziness prevented me from sending it back., "After a couple months of trying (yeah, Im really that lazy), I finally got it to stop stinking. It works fine, but is SLOW."

"Im an avid tea drinker from the UK and when replacing my old, cheap kettle, I opted for this one. It looks expensive for the price, but is well made and sturdy. The kettle fits onto the pedestal without clanking it on too hard ( Im pretty Shrek fisted) It boils fairly quickly considering the low voltage here, after 3 months of daily use it doesnt need cleaning yet."
Disappointed, came broken

Well this tea pot works very good., After years of steeping on the stove or using a dedicated coffee maker for our tea, we decided to give this a try and it works surprisingly well., Easy to fill, brews fast, and easy to clean.
Bought this for my parents. Their old tea kettle had seen better days and it was time for a new one. What an upgrade this was!

"Ive had a few kettles before, but this one is easily my favorite. Price point was not too bad for what I consider a very high quality product. The blue LED makes it look really nice, too. I love mine!"
"This is great for tea, oatmeal, dry soups anything that needs hot water...  Dont over fill it!  Very easy to use and clean up.  We really enjoy this."
Excellent quality, works great, it is a little slow, not sure why i would be, perhaps to avoid thermal expansion of the glass?
Absolutely love this so far!  It heats up very quickly which makes it so much faster and easier for me to make my coffee and tea.

the kettle itself is a lot bigger than I expected but everything works perfectly well. The lights around the kettle are very pretty when boiling the water but I think this would be slightly inconvenient to clean.
Love this kettle. Use it to make hot tea. I’ll never go back to boiling water on the stove as this boils water within 1-2 minutes max. Love how it automatically shuts off once the water is boiling.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super fast, so easy to clean. Love it!
reviews.reviewText: It looks so slick on my kitchen counter where I leave it during the cooler months! Cleans so quickly (I wipe it down once a day with a damp cloth on the outside) and it boils soooo fast! I use it for drinks and to jumpstart cooking! Talk about quick pasta!
I bought this water kettle to make tea at work and it is perfect. It heats the water fast and is easy to use and clean. I would definitely recommend!
Very solid hot water kettle. Plenty of different temperature settings for different drinks. Pretty nice on the eyes, too!
I used this to heat my water from my French press coffee. I like watching the blues light and then the bubbles coming up. It Heats the water up super fast.

This lights up blue while heating then turns off when done it has a filter at the mouth so if I wanted to make a big pitcher of tea i could easy to fill and clean my only qualm is the very very short cord it had to plug into the wall

Absolutely LOVE this kettle. It replaced our stovetop on and I’m so glad about it. It feels like such an upgrades in fact. I was able to create a coffee station in our dining room which frees up traffic and space in the kitchen. Heats quickly, it looks cool when it’s lit up, and is super easy to use! Highly recommended!
This is my travel kettle. It goes with me so I can fix my tea anytime. Love how quick it heats up. Keep it clean and it tastes great.

Never took into consideration that I may have to add water while still hot. So if it is still hot I boil water otherwise.
Like the blue lights when it heats, takes a little longer to get hot compared to my previous all metal pot but overall good product!
Love this piece!  Easy to use, heats super fast!  I use it every morning to make tea for my girls.

reviews.reviewTitle: So disappointed. Believe the 1-2 star reviews.
reviews.reviewText: I just received my tea kettle this afternoon and already there are 2 glaring issues:, 1. There is no way (that I can find) to make the base sit flat. The beginning of the cord is always under the base so it makes it uneven and it shifts from side to side., 2. It takes 9.5 minutes to boil a minimum amount of water. I can get quicker boiled water from a pot on the stove., 3. There’s no safety lock to ensure the kettle is secure on the base. You can put it on at any angle and it’ll work, but I feel like there should be some sort of “click” or “lock in place” to be sure it’s secure., This is the most disappointing purchase I’ve ever made. Wanted to give the product a chance, but truly should have believed the reviews I read.

reviews.reviewTitle: "Its fast and I love the automatic shutoff"
reviews.reviewText: My last water pot was destroyed when I left it on . It burned itself into a black mess that looked like it was ready to melt into a puddle.  When I saw it I almost had a heart attack., I immediately started looking for a new pot with an automatic shut off.  This one has a cool light that glows when the pot is running then shuts off when it reaches its optimal temperature.  I love the auto shut off.  The glowing coil is pretty cool too., If I want boiling water fairly quickly, say for coffee because I use a French press, or tea, this is great., "Just a note:  dont put anything other than water into your pot.  It will ruin it.  Only, only water. I also like to turn the pot upside down after I empty it.  I  I dont want mineral deposits building up.", This is a really nice pot.

"I bought this clear glass kettle because it looks good and you can see inside to tell when its dirty.  I use it in a short-term rental and occasionally guests will do stupid things like boil eggs or cook Ramen noodles in the water kettle.  The clear glass makes it easy to see any type of residue inside.  I like how the whole kettle glows when its heating.  I like how the extra cord can be hidden inside the base.  It boils water fast, not like the 220V kettles in Europe, but still a lot faster than boiling a pot on the stove.  Its been working great for 6 months.", "The only thing I dont like is that the opening in the top of the kettle is too small to get my hand inside to clean it.  I dont have huge hands, but I wear a mens size large glove.  People with smaller hands probably wouldnt have this problem."

"I have stored my old teakettle in the closet. This item is wonderful, so easy to use and so quick to heat water. I only give it 3 stars for cleaning because the top doesnt come off. Thats because the electrical components are located in the lid. That said, when you use it, just pour the unused water out and open the lid. It will dry all by itself. I use filtered water so there are no water deposits on the glass. Assuming it has a long life, its one of my best Amazon purchases."

"Overall the kettle itself is nice and of decent quality. It is aesthetically nice to look at, I dont feel the need to hide it in a cabinet. it has no problems heating up the water to a nice temperature. My only complaint is that the base is very lightweight and uneven. So the kettle wiggles. The cord is very thick and rigid and it will take some time to get it bent in the position you want it. And when the bass is lightweight it makes it difficult to stay flat, but after having it for a couple weeks the cord is now staying where I need it and the base is staying in the spot I need it. Overall its pretty decent kettle for the price though."

Got this for my office because I was tired of having to run the water twice thru the Keurig machine.  I turn this on and a minute later I have boiling hot water for my tea,  oatmeal and hot cocoa. Awesome kettle. I highly recommend it.

The label telling me that is located on the bottom of kettle do I didnt see it till it was too late. So needless to say I wont be plugging it in to an outlet now! Need better notice that it cannot be put in water."

Being physically disabled, I needed an easier way to boil water for drink and food. So I decided to cave and get an electric kettle. It boils a liter of water in three (3) minutes so I really can’t complain. One of the “cheaper” options out there but it gets the job done. Love it! And my cat wasn’t afraid of boiling water so that’s just a bonus.

It boils water successfully., However, being a Brit abroad I drink a lot of tea and therefore use the kettle a lot. The lid on this thing feels so flimsy. The filter flips up with the lid so when you fill the kettle the filter physically gets in the way., "Its also slow. Oh. So. Slow.", So if you are a Brit who wants a lot of tea but like an American wants is NOW then this kettle is not for you., It looks nice though with all those blue LEDs in the bottom until it boils. Trouble is, since it takes forever to boil, those LEDs are not going to last the life of the kettle. Mind you, since the lid is sure to give out first, the point it probably moot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the look.  Can burn you
reviews.reviewText: I love the look of this kettle.  The blue lights at the base are cool!, However, the handle should not go to the top.  This creates a situation where if you hand is too high on the handle, it can get burned by steam when pouring the boiling water.  Also, if you fill it up to maximum allowed capacity, the handle itself gets very hot., I still like  it.  Just have to be careful how I use it.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Electric Tea Kettle to get.
reviews.reviewText: "I am very pleased with this Electric Tea Kettle. Its fun watching the water come to a boil with the blue light that lets you know when it is finished. It is quicker than our previous Electric Tea Kettle. The filter makes is a little difficult to get my hand in there to clean but it stays clean for several fills. Another winner for price and ease of use."

reviews.reviewTitle: WHY IS THIS NOT A FIXTURE OF EVERY HOME!?
reviews.reviewText: "After using this kettle, I have to wonder why this isnt a fixture of every American home. Our Euro friends are absolutely right, this makes any application where boiling water is required MUCH faster and easier; simply fill the pot, set it on the base, hit the button, and go work on your other steps for a couple of minutes while the kettle boils. Once you hear it click off, you have a full kettle of boiling water ready to go."

reviews.reviewTitle: Ex Took Their Kettle and I Upgraded
reviews.reviewText: I was going to replace the stovetop kettle my ex took with them.  My sister pointed out this type of kettle as a better option.  She was right. This heats quickly.  I even use it in concert with heating water on the stovetop and add it once it boils.  Makes that process more efficient.  In fact, my ex bought one of these himself as he saw how well it works.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy. Pretty. Super functional with 1 hand ease
reviews.reviewText: Not only gorgeous addition on or off to any kitchen. Runs quiet, not silent. Auto off and especially important for me is the ease of use., Perfect balance make this kettle easy for weaker wrists. Im able to lift, fill, pour and replace without ever dripping a drop.
